## Example: Economic Downturn

:::: columns

::: {.column width="50%" #vcenter .r-fit-text}
 - Economic Downturn not specified in Basel Framework or CRR
 - EBA has drafted an RTS, elevated into regulation CDR 2021/930
 - EGIM is not more specific
:::


::: {.column width="50%" #vcenter .r-fit-text}
::: {.callout-note}
## CRE 36.85
$\small{[\cdots]}$ _A bank must estimate an LGD for each facility that aims to reflect economic downturn conditions where necessary to capture the relevant risks._ $\small{[\cdots]}$
:::
::: {.callout-note}
## CRR Article 181
_(1)(b) institutions shall use LGD estimates that are appropriate for an economic downturn if those are more conservative than the long-run average._ $\small{[\cdots]}$

_(3) EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the following: (a) the nature, severity and duration of an economic downturn referred to in paragraph 1;_ $\small{[\cdots]}$
:::

::: {.callout-note}
## CDR 2021/930 Article 1
_Specification of the nature, severity and duration of an economic downturn_ $\small{[\cdots]}$
:::
:::
::::

::: notes
Show Basel CRE36.64, article 4(78), GL PD/LGD par 73ff
:::

## Risk Parameter Quantification

:::: columns

::: {.column width="50%" .r-fit-text}

Reference dates
: Date to which realised values are aggregated

Calibration Target (CT)
: long-run average (LRA) default rate, (LRA/DT) LGD, CCF calculated based on RDS prior to adjustments

Appropriate Adjustment
: Modeled effect on CT of drivers of non-representativeness / other sources of bias

Appr. Adj. CT
: Calibration Target adjusted for biases

:::

## Reference Data Sets {auto-animate=true}

:::: columns

::: {.column width="60%" .r-fit-text}

Length of historical period
: min. requirements (5 or 7 yr) + available relevant internal data on comparable exposures

Methodology
: (non-)overlapping [**PD**], time-to-default [**LGD**, **CCF**], recovery process [**in-default**]

Exposure attributes
: identify exposures at historical observation dates

Default/loss characteristics
: Observed default/loss data aggregated by exposure over observation period at reference date (target variable)

Risk characteristics
: Risk drivers, appropriate adjustment variables

Observation windows
: aggregate to obtain targets (fwd) or variables (bwd) 

:::

## Calibration Targets {auto-animate=true}

:::: columns

::: {.column width="50%" .r-fit-text}

Methodology
: (non-)overlapping [**PD**], time-to-default [**LGD**, **CCF**], time-in-default/recovery process [**in-default**]

Reference dates $t_r$
: set of dates over which calibration target is calculated, either as an average (LRA LGD), average of yearly averages (PD & LRA CCF), or an estimated downturn effect (DT LGD/CCF)

Calibration level $L$
: level of aggregation (range of appl. $\supseteq$ calibration segment $\supset$ grade/pool)

(Initial) calibration target
: risk parameter calibration target not accounting for biases, i.e., long-run average default rate, (in-default) LRA/DT LGD/CCF, prior to appr. adj.

:::

::: {.column width="50%" #vcenter .r-fit-text }
![](/media/rds_aggr_general.drawio.svg)

<!-- $\text{Cal. target} \sim \sum_{r}w_r\sum_{i\in\mathbf{L}}v_i y_i(t_r)$ -->

:::

## Calibration Targets (**PD**) {auto-animate=true}

:::: columns

::: {.column width="50%" .r-fit-text}
Length of historical period
: (up to) a length that *reflects the likely range of variability of default rates of that type of exposures*

Methodology
: overlapping versus non-overlapping

Reference dates $t_{r}$
: sample over historical data over observation dates of performing exposures

Calibration level (**L**)
: level of aggregation (range of appl. $\supseteq$ calibration segment $\supset$ grade/pool)

Calibration target $DR$
: average of default rates per (yearly) reference date

:::

::: {.column width="50%" .r-fit-text }
![](/media/rds_aggr_pd.drawio.svg)

$\text{DR}(\mathbf{L}) = \frac{1}{R}\sum_{r=1\dots R}\frac{1}{N_\mathbf{L}(t_r)}\sum_{i\in\mathbf{L}} D_i(t_r)$

:::

## Realised LGD {auto-animate=true .smaller}

:::: columns

::: {.column width="70%" .r-fit-text}
::: {data-id="r0" .highlight-block}
Outstanding (O)
: Credit obligation outstanding at $t_{def}$
:::

 * irrespective of prior write-offs or forgiveness
 * excluding fees/payments not capitalised at $t_{def}$ and v.v.
 * including costs of recovery discounted to $t_{def}$
 * (retail/Basel IV): including additional drawings after default


::: {data-id="r1"}
Recoveries (R)
: Discounted cash flows from any recoveries and payments
:::
:::
::: {.column width="30%" .r-fit-text}
$RLGD = \frac{\max(O-R,0)}{O}$
:::

::::
## Realised LGD {auto-animate=true .smaller}

:::: columns

::: {.column width="70%" .r-fit-text}
Outstanding (O)
: Credit obligation outstanding at $t_{def}$

::: {data-id="r1" .highlight-block}
Recoveries (R)
: Discounted cash flows from any recoveries and payments
:::

 * Unsecured as well as secured (eligible+ineligible)
 * Including regular contractual payments
 * Including discounted outstanding at default end in case of return to performing ("artificial cash flow")

:::


::: {.column width="30%" .r-fit-text}
$RLGD = \frac{\max(O-R,0)}{O}$
:::

## Observed Average LGD {.smaller}

Default-weighted^[i.e., number of defaults weighted] average of realised LGD, including

 * closed recoveries
 * recoveries where $t_{end} - t_{def} > \text{MRP}$
 * repaid/written-off exposures
 * exposures returned to performing status ("cured")

::: aside
Return to performing (cure) following Definition of Default (DoD) policy, including probation period and after multiple default treatment.

# Margin of Conservatism

## Margin of Conservatism

:::: columns

::: {.column width="50%" #vcenter .r-fit-text }

 * Basel III and CRR prescribe a Margin of Conservatism in general terms only
 * EBA Guidelines on PD & LGD more specific
   + Specification and clarification of general idea
   + Prescribes additional steps in estimation
   + Introduces (harmonizing) minimal requirements (MoC A, B, C>0)

:::

::: {.column width="50%" #vcenter .r-fit-text}

::::: {.callout-note}
## CRE 36.67
_In general, estimates of PDs, LGDs, and EADs are likely to involve unpredictable errors. In order to avoid over-optimism, a bank must add to its estimates a margin of conservatism that is related to the likely range of errors. Where methods and data are less satisfactory and the likely range of errors is larger, the margin of conservatism must be larger._
:::::

::::: {.callout-note}
## CRR Article 179(f)
_An institution shall add to its estimates a margin of conservatism that is related to the expected range of estimation errors. Where methods and data are considered to be less satisfactory, the expected range of errors is larger, the margin of conservatism shall be larger._
:::::
::::: {.callout-note}
## EBA/GL/2017/16 43
_In order to quantify MoC institutions should do all of the following: (a) quantify MoC for the identified deficiencies [...] ensuring that: (i) where appropriate adjustments [...] are used, the MoC accounts for any increase in the uncertainty [...] (b) quantify the general estimation error [...]_ 
:::::

:::
